Apple___Apple_scab.symptoms: Olive-green to brown velvety spots on leaves; dark, scabby lesions on fruit
home_remedies: Spray with a baking soda solution (1 tbsp per gallon of water + few drops dish soap)
Apply neem oil spray every 7-14 days during growing season
Remove and destroy fallen infected leaves to break the cycle
Apple___Apple_scab.prevention: Ensure good air circulation; avoid overhead watering; rake up fallen leaves in autumn

Apple___Black_rot.symptoms: Brown, expanding lesions with concentric rings on fruit; frogeye leaf spots
home_remedies: Prune out dead or infected branches during dormant season
Apply neem oil spray to affected areas
Remove mummified fruit from trees and ground
Apple___Black_rot.prevention: Maintain tree hygiene; remove all infected material; ensure good air circulation

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.symptoms: Bright orange-yellow spots on upper leaf surface; tube-like structures on leaf undersides
home_remedies: Remove nearby juniper/cedar trees if possible (alternate host)
Spray with neem oil in early spring before symptoms appear
Apply a baking soda spray (1 tbsp per gallon) every 7 days
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.prevention: Plant rust-resistant apple varieties; remove galls from junipers within a few hundred feet

Apple___healthy.prevention: Continue good care: proper watering, pruning, and seasonal cleanup

Blueberry___healthy.prevention: Maintain acidic soil (pH 4.5-5.5); mulch with pine needles; prune annually

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White powdery coating on leaves, shoots, and fruit; leaf curling and distortion
home_remedies: Spray milk solution (1 part milk to 9 parts water) on affected areas
Apply baking soda spray (1 tbsp per gallon + dish soap)
Use neem oil spray every 7-10 days
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.prevention: Ensure good air circulation; avoid overhead watering; prune to open canopy

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.prevention: Regular pruning for air flow; proper irrigation; seasonal dormant sprays

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray.symptoms: Rectangular gray to tan lesions running parallel to leaf veins
home_remedies: Remove and destroy infected crop debris after harvest
Rotate crops (avoid planting corn in the same spot consecutively)
Apply compost tea as a foliar spray to boost plant immunity
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray.prevention: Practice crop rotation; choose resistant varieties; till under infected residue

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.symptoms: Small, reddish-brown to dark brown pustules on both leaf surfaces
home_remedies: Apply neem oil spray to slow spread
Remove heavily infected lower leaves
Spray with a garlic extract solution (blend garlic in water, strain, spray)
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.prevention: Plant resistant varieties; avoid late planting; ensure adequate spacing

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.symptoms: Long, elliptical gray-green to tan lesions (1-6 inches) on leaves
home_remedies: Remove and destroy infected leaves
Apply compost tea or dilute hydrogen peroxide (1 tbsp per gallon) as foliar spray
Improve air circulation by proper plant spacing
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.prevention: Crop rotation; resistant varieties; remove corn debris in fall

Corn_(maize)___healthy.prevention: Maintain adequate spacing; rotate crops annually; balanced fertilization

Grape___Black_rot.symptoms: Small brown circular spots on leaves; fruit turns brown then shrivels into hard mummies
home_remedies: Remove and destroy all mummified berries and infected leaves
Apply baking soda spray (1 tbsp per gallon) weekly during wet periods
Spray neem oil in early spring before flowering
Grape___Black_rot.prevention: Good canopy management; remove mummies; prune for air circulation

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).symptoms: Interveinal leaf discoloration (tiger-stripe pattern); dark spots on berries
home_remedies: Prune out dead or symptomatic wood during dry weather
Apply wound paste to large pruning cuts to prevent fungal entry
There is no known cure; manage by reducing vine stress
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).prevention: Minimize large pruning wounds; prune late in dormant season; avoid vine stress

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.symptoms: Dark brown angular spots on leaves, often with a yellow halo; premature defoliation
home_remedies: Remove and destroy affected leaves promptly
Spray dilute neem oil every 10-14 days
Apply garlic-chili spray as a natural fungicide
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.prevention: Ensure good air flow in canopy; avoid overhead irrigation; clean up fallen debris

Grape___healthy.prevention: Regular canopy management; balanced nutrition; proper irrigation

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).symptoms: Asymmetric yellow mottling on leaves; lopsided bitter fruit; premature fruit drop
home_remedies: No cure exists; manage symptoms by maintaining tree health with balanced fertilizer
Control Asian citrus psyllid (vector) with insecticidal soap or neem oil
Apply micronutrient foliar sprays (zinc, manganese) to support the tree
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).prevention: Control psyllid populations; inspect new plants before planting; remove infected trees to prevent spread

Peach___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small dark spots on leaves that may fall out (shot-hole); sunken lesions on fruit
home_remedies: Apply copper-based spray (Bordeaux mixture) in early spring
Remove and destroy heavily infected branches
Improve tree nutrition with compost and balanced fertilizer
Peach___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Plant resistant varieties; avoid overhead watering; ensure good drainage

Peach___healthy.prevention: Annual dormant spray; proper pruning; good air circulation

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit; leaf yellowing and drop
home_remedies: Remove and destroy infected plant parts immediately
Apply copper spray (1-2 tbsp copper sulfate per gallon) every 7-10 days
Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash onto leaves
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds; rotate crops every 2-3 years; avoid working with wet plants

Pepper,_bell___healthy.prevention: Crop rotation; proper spacing; consistent watering; stake plants for air flow

Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings (target pattern) on lower leaves first
home_remedies: Remove infected lower leaves promptly
Apply baking soda spray (1 tbsp per gallon) every 5-7 days
Spray neem oil to slow fungal spread
Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Crop rotation (3-year); adequate spacing; mulch to prevent soil splash; balanced fertilizer

Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Large, dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves; white mold on leaf undersides; rapid wilting
home_remedies: Remove and destroy ALL infected plants immediately (do not compost)
Apply copper-based fungicide as emergency treatment
Harvest tubers early if infection is detected to save crop
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Plant certified disease-free seed potatoes; avoid overhead watering; destroy volunteer plants

Potato___healthy.prevention: Use certified seed potatoes; hill soil around stems; maintain consistent moisture

Raspberry___healthy.prevention: Annual pruning of spent canes; good air circulation; mulch to retain moisture

Soybean___healthy.prevention: Crop rotation; proper inoculation; scout regularly for early signs of stress

Squash___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White powdery patches on upper leaf surfaces; leaves yellow and die prematurely
home_remedies: Spray milk solution (1 part milk to 9 parts water) in morning sun
Apply baking soda spray (1 tbsp per gallon + few drops dish soap)
Neem oil spray every 7-10 days as preventive and treatment
Squash___Powdery_mildew.prevention: Plant resistant varieties; ensure spacing for air flow; avoid late-day watering

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.symptoms: Small dark purple spots on leaves that enlarge; leaf margins dry and curl up
home_remedies: Remove and destroy infected leaves
Apply neem oil spray every 10 days
Renovate beds after harvest by mowing and thinning
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.prevention: Use resistant varieties; ensure good drainage; thin runners for air circulation

Strawberry___healthy.prevention: Mulch with straw; control runners; replace plants every 3-4 years

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit; raised scab-like spots on fruit
home_remedies: Remove infected leaves and fruit immediately
Apply copper spray every 7-10 days during wet weather
Mulch heavily to prevent rain splash from soil
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds/transplants; rotate crops 2-3 years; avoid overhead watering

Tomato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric ring spots (bulls-eye) on lower leaves; stems may show dark cankers
home_remedies: Prune lower branches to improve air flow
Apply baking soda spray (1 tbsp per gallon with a drop of dish soap)
Mulch around base to prevent soil splash
Tomato___Early_blight.prevention: Crop rotation; stake plants; water at soil level; remove infected debris

Tomato___Late_blight.symptoms: Large, dark, water-soaked patches on leaves; white fuzzy growth underneath; rapid plant death
home_remedies: URGENT: Remove and bag (do not compost) ALL infected plants immediately
Apply copper fungicide to nearby uninfected plants as protection
Late blight spreads rapidly; act within 24 hours
Tomato___Late_blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties; avoid overhead watering; space plants widely for air flow

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Pale yellow spots on upper leaves; olive-green to gray fuzzy mold on undersides
home_remedies: Improve ventilation (especially in greenhouses)
Apply baking soda spray or neem oil every 7 days
Remove and destroy affected lower leaves
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.prevention: Ensure good ventilation; reduce humidity; avoid wetting foliage; space plants adequately

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Many small circular spots with dark borders and gray centers on lower leaves
home_remedies: Remove and destroy infected lower leaves immediately
Apply neem oil or copper spray every 7-10 days
Mulch around plants to reduce rain splash
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Crop rotation; avoid overhead watering; mulch; remove plant debris at end of season

Tomato___Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider.symptoms: Tiny yellow speckling on leaves; fine webbing on undersides; leaves dry out and drop
home_remedies: Spray plants forcefully with water to knock off mites
Apply neem oil spray covering leaf undersides every 5 days
Mix 1 tbsp dish soap per quart of water and spray undersides
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider.prevention: Keep plants well-watered (mites thrive in dry conditions); avoid dusty areas; encourage predatory mites

Tomato___Target_Spot.symptoms: Brown spots with concentric rings on leaves, stems, and fruit
home_remedies: Remove and destroy infected plant parts
Apply copper-based fungicide spray
Improve air circulation by pruning suckers
Tomato___Target_Spot.prevention: Crop rotation; adequate spacing; stake or cage plants; avoid working with wet plants

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.symptoms: Leaves curl upward and turn yellow; stunted growth; reduced or no fruit production
home_remedies: Remove and destroy infected plants to prevent spread
Control whiteflies (vector) with yellow sticky traps
Spray neem oil to repel whiteflies from healthy plants
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.prevention: Use resistant varieties; install reflective mulch to deter whiteflies; use row covers for young plants

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled light and dark green mosaic pattern on leaves; distorted leaf growth; reduced yields
home_remedies: No cure; remove and destroy infected plants (do not compost)
Wash hands and tools with milk or 10% bleach solution between plants
Control aphids (vector) with insecticidal soap
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.prevention: Use resistant varieties; disinfect tools; wash hands before handling plants; avoid tobacco near plants

Tomato___healthy.prevention: Consistent watering; balanced fertilizer; stake for support; prune suckers for air flow
